(11/5/2020 11:38 AM MB)
Please read below and confirm what the reviewing Engineer is requesting. 



The contractor is required to patch the open cut area in the street that is minimally necessary to make the connection.  The City will seal the perimeter of it as part the Street Preventative Maintenance contract work. The minimum composition of the cross section required for the patch on this local street is shown below

	Asphalt Pavement - Match existing thickness (3 inches minimum of LVSP or 13A HMA mix)
	Base - 8 inches of Class 21 AA Dense-Graded Aggregate
	Subbase  6 inches of Class II Granular Material (typically this will be thicker since this material will also be used as backfill above the connection)


If Mr. Knight says he is not cutting the pavement, I would like him to acknowledge that he has informed the homeowner that they are responsible for the remainder of the lead to the sewer main, and that if the portion of the lead under the road is Orangeburg, failure is likely.

(2/5/2021 2:03 PM TGAB)
We have reviewed the above referenced permit application and recommend the permit application be conditionally approved based on the following conditions:  

1. Permittee shall not store or place equipment and/or materials inside dripline of any city-owned tree. 

2. All trees in right-of-way should be bored under.  Bore pits and open trenches are not permitted within the dripline of any city-owned tree.  

3. Permittee is responsible for properly pruning trees to prevent damage. If branches greater than 2 inches in diameter require pruning, contact Forestry for consultation and evaluation.

4. No roots of city-owned trees greater than 2 inches in diameter are to be cut. If permittee/contractor encounters city-owned trees with roots greater than 2 inches in diameter that they determine need to be cut, contact Forestry.

5. Mechanical damage to city-owned trees (i.e. bark damage, branch breakage) is not permitted.  Oak trees are not permitted to be pruned from April-November.  Permittee is responsible for properly pruning trees to prevent damage. If extensive pruning is necessary, please contact Forestry.

6. If any city-owned street trees are damaged by this work, the permittee/contractor must contact Forestry as soon as possible so that the damage can be assessed. Permittee will be responsible for all costs associated with damage remediation.

Forestry Contact Information: 734-794-6350

ROW21-0124

If you have any questions, please contact me.

David Walsh
Gas Planner
